thread.title: Sensex Today: Sensex pares gains after touching 29,000; telecom stocks surge, RIL tanks 2%
thread.title_full: Sensex Today: Sensex pares gains after touching 29,000; telecom stocks surge, RIL tanks 2% - The Economic Times

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Sensex Today: Sensex pares gains after touching 29,000; telecom stocks surge, RIL tanks 2%
text:
NEW DELHI: Benchmark equity index BSE Sensex on Thursday hit mount 29,000 in the mid-session before paring most of the day’s gains in the last hour of trade to close 28.26 points, or 0.10 per cent, up at 28,892.97. 

The index again hit a fresh 5-month high on Thursday. 

NSE Nifty index also hit its fresh 52-week high of 8,982.15 before settling 12.60 points, or 0.14 per cent, higher at 8,939.50 on account of some buying by institutional investors amid expiry of derivative contracts. 

In the Nifty 50-index, Idea Cellular (up 6.39 per cent), TCS (up 2.80 per cent), Wipro (up 2.42 per cent), Kotak Mahindra Bank (up 1.72 per cent) and Infosys (up 1.66 per cent) stood among major gainers. 

On the other hand Grasim Industries (down 2.24 per cent ), RIL (down 1.71 per cent ), Aurobindo Pharma (down 1.58 per cent), Bharti Infratel (down 1.26 per cent ) and Eicher Motors (down 1.25 per cent ) stood among top losers in the index. 

Shares of VKS Projects, Indiabulls Ventures, Pearl Polymers, RBL Bank, Vardhman Hold hit their fresh 52-week high on NSE, while Raj Rayon , Tricom India , BS Ltd , TD Power Sys, Panoramic Uni touched their fresh 52-week low. 

On Thursday, 23 stocks advanced in the Nifty50 index, while 28 scrips ended the day in red. 

Sectorwise, the BSE Telecom and IT index closed higher by 1.82 per cent and 1.70 per cent. The BSE Power and Oil & Gas index slipped 0.68 per cent and 0.26 per cent, respectively. 

“Nifty closed flat on the F&O expiry day amid volatility, ignoring feeble global cues. Participants choose to overlook the latest statement from the US Fed indicating probable rate hike as early as next month,” said Jayant Manglik, President, Retail Distribution, Religare Securities. 

“We reiterate our view to maintain positive yet cautious approach and focus more on the stock selection. We feel auto and FMCG could see fresh traction after the recent pause,” Manglik added. 

Global stocks eased from record highs on Thursday. 

In the oil market, Brent crude settled down 82 cents or 1.45 per cent at $55.84 a barrel, while US crude settled 74 cents or 1.36 per cent lower at $53.59, Reuters reported. 

Spot gold prices rose $2.83 to $1,238.73 an ounce, erasing losses following the release of the Fed minutes.
